name: Crispy Vegetable Pakoras
author: veggigoddess
summary: These are very yummy, and if any of you have ever had Japanese tempura coated veggies, you'll love this recipe. It's similar, yet it is unique in it's taste.  Serve with a chili sauce, mint yogurt sauce, or sweet and sour sauce. Try other vegetables for dipping, such as sweet potatoes, broccoli and asparagus.
directions: Sift the chickpea flour into a medium bowl
Mix in the coriander, salt, turmeric, chili powder, garam masala and garlic
Make a well in the center of the flower
Gradually pour the water into the well and mix to form a thick, smooth batter
Over medium high heat in a large, heavy saucepan, heat the oil to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C)
Coat the cauliflower and onions in the batter and fry them in small batches until golden brown, about 4 to 5 minutes
Drain on paper towels before serving
